newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT - India ends steady, upside limited.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT - India ends steady, upside limited.

text.p: Indian Global Depositary Receipts registered steady gains amid selective interest on Wednesday as prices shrugged off falls in the local market earlier.
Traders said the market had seen good demand for some key stocks, which had contributed to a steady close. But movement was seen limited in the next few days.
"There is limited upside potential but overall the market is not looking bad," said a trader.
He said demand had appeared for Reliance, with Larsen attracting late interest to end higher. SBI was lower after easing in India.
Bombay's benchmark 30-share index was down 22.91 points at 3,354.72 or 0.68 percent.
Reliance was at $13.50/14.50, up 0.02, while Larsen & Toubro made 0.37 to $13.50/14.50.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed 0.33 points or 0.50 percent up at 65.70, with the premium over the local market at 14.16 percent from 12.68 percent on Tuesday.

The Capel Korea GDR Index ended down 1.16 points at 66.60 with a premium of 45.25 percent over the local market. The Taiwan GDR Index finished down 0.84 points at 100.55, with a premium of 4.04 percent.
